section.title: Operation 68: SEEK - Find the Next Data or Hole
DESCRIPTION
section.t: SEEK is an operation that allows a client to determine the location of the next data_content4 in a file. It allows an implementation of the emerging extension to lseek(2) to allow clients to determine the next hole whilst in data or the next data whilst in a hole.

From the given sa_offset, find the next data_content4 of type sa_what in the file. If the server can not find a corresponding sa_what, then the status will still be NFS4_OK, but sr_eof would be TRUE. If the server can find the sa_what, then the sr_offset is the start of that content and sr_allocated is the space reservation status.
SEEK must follow the same rules for stateids as READ_PLUS ().
